docs.title: Technical Writing Portfolio
docs.text:
Welcome to my Docs-as-Code documentation portfolio.

This site demonstrates how I plan, write, review, and publish enterprise SaaS documentation using Git, Markdown, and MkDocs.

docs.title: What this portfolio showcases
docs.text:
• Release Notes and What’s New
  • User Guides and Online Help
  • How-To Guides
  • FAQs and Troubleshooting
  • UX Microcopy patterns
  • Release Highlights video scripting

docs.title: Experience represented
docs.text:
This portfolio reflects 14+ years of experience documenting complex enterprise and cloud-based SaaS products and leading technical writing teams.

All content is sample documentation created for demonstration purposes only.

docs.title: Release Notes
docs.text:
This section provides a detailed overview of monthly product releases covering new features, enhancements, and platform improvements.

Each release highlights: - Customer-facing functionality - AI-assisted capabilities - Performance and scalability improvements - Governance and administrative enhancements

docs.title: Available releases
docs.text:
Use the navigation to explore detailed release notes for each version.

These release notes represent sample enterprise SaaS documentation created to demonstrate documentation depth, structure, and clarity.

docs.title: Release Notes – Version 2025.10
docs.text: Release Date: October 2025 Focus Areas: Planning efficiency, governance, insight clarity

docs.title: Change Impact Preview
docs.text:
Users can preview downstream impacts before saving changes.

Read more The preview identifies affected reports, KPIs, and dependent scenarios, helping users make informed decisions.

docs.title: AI-Suggested Forecast Drivers
docs.text:
The system suggests relevant forecast drivers.

Read more AI analyzes historical correlations and proposes drivers that users can review and apply as needed.

docs.title: Bulk Administrative Updates
docs.text:
Admins can update settings across multiple entities.

Read more Bulk actions reduce repetitive configuration tasks and improve consistency.

docs.title: Improved Error Messaging
docs.text:
Error messages are clearer and more actionable.

Read more Messages now explain the issue and recommended resolution, reducing user confusion.

docs.title: Performance Optimizations for Large Models
docs.text:
Complex models perform more reliably.

Read more Optimizations reduce calculation times and timeout scenarios.

docs.title: Release Notes – Version 2025.11
docs.text: Release Date: November 2025 Focus Areas: Collaboration, planning accuracy, admin control

docs.title: Collaborative Review Comments
docs.text:
Users can now add comments directly within forecasts.

Read more Comments stay associated with specific data points and persist across refreshes, improving cross-team reviews.

docs.title: AI-Based Outlier Detection
docs.text:
Potentially incorrect values are flagged during data entry.

Read more AI compares current inputs against historical patterns to surface anomalies before submission.

docs.title: Admin Role Preview
docs.text:
Admins can preview effective user access.

Read more This helps validate permissions before rollout and reduces access-related issues.

docs.title: Faster Scenario Switching
docs.text:
Scenario navigation is noticeably quicker.

Read more Caching improvements reduce wait times when switching between commonly used scenarios.

docs.title: Data Entry Guidance Enhancements
docs.text:
Inline guidance has been expanded.

Read more Users receive clearer instructions during data entry, improving first-pass accuracy.

docs.title: Release Notes – Version 2025.12
docs.text: Release Date: December 2025 Focus Areas: Review efficiency, auditability, AI-assisted analysis

docs.title: AI-Powered Variance Summaries
docs.text:
The system now summarizes major variances automatically.

Read more AI analyzes changes across versions and highlights the most material drivers, reducing manual review effort during close cycles.

docs.title: Review Mode for Forecasts
docs.text:
A dedicated read-only review experience is now available.

Read more Review Mode simplifies navigation, hides editing controls, and focuses attention on key metrics and changes.

docs.title: Enhanced Audit Trail Filters
docs.text:
Audit logs are easier to search and analyze.

Read more Users can filter by user, action type, or time range, improving traceability and compliance workflows.

docs.title: Improved Export Reliability
docs.text:
Large exports are more stable and resumable.

Read more Export jobs recover gracefully from interruptions, reducing failed downloads for executive reports.

docs.title: Usability Improvements Across Planning Screens
docs.text:
Several high-traffic screens have been refined.

Read more Improvements include clearer labels, improved spacing, and more consistent interaction patterns.

docs.title: Release Notes – Version 2025.9
docs.text: Release Date: September 2025 Focus Areas: Foundations, usability, planning confidence

docs.title: Forecast Health Indicators
docs.text:
Visual indicators communicate forecast readiness.

Read more Indicators reflect data completeness and variance, helping users assess confidence quickly.

docs.title: Guided Planning Templates
docs.text:
New templates support common planning scenarios.

Read more Templates include built-in structure, validation, and inline guidance to accelerate setup.

docs.title: Improved Initial Load Performance
docs.text:
First-time access is faster across modules.

Read more Backend improvements reduce load times, especially for new users.

docs.title: Expanded Validation Rules
docs.text:
Validation logic is more configurable.

Read more Admins can define threshold-based and conditional validation rules.

docs.title: User Activity Timeline
docs.text:
Users can review recent actions.

Read more The timeline improves transparency and supports self-review.

docs.title: Release Notes – Version 2026.1
docs.text:
Release Date: January 2026 Focus Areas: AI-guided decision making, scale, executive readiness

This release introduces AI-driven guidance across planning workflows, along with enhancements designed to support enterprise-wide adoption and executive review cycles.

docs.title: AI-Guided Forecast Risk Signals
docs.text:
The platform now highlights potential forecast risks using AI-driven analysis.

Read more Risk signals analyze historical accuracy, volatility, and data completeness to identify forecasts that may require attention. Indicators appear directly within forecast views and summary dashboards. This helps finance teams prioritize review efforts without manual analysis.

docs.title: Executive Summary Auto-Drafts
docs.text:
AI can now generate executive-ready forecast summaries.

Read more Based on forecast changes and key drivers, the system produces clear, concise narrative drafts suitable for leadership updates. Users remain in control and can edit or refine all generated content.

docs.title: Scenario Confidence Scoring
docs.text:
Each scenario now includes a confidence score.

Read more Confidence scores reflect data coverage, variance levels, and historical accuracy, giving stakeholders quick context before making decisions.

docs.title: Enterprise-Scale Performance Improvements
docs.text:
Large, multi-entity forecasts load and recalculate faster.

Read more Backend optimizations improve performance for organizations with complex hierarchies and long planning horizons.

docs.title: Enhanced Validation Insights
docs.text:
Validation messages now include contextual explanations.

Read more Messages explain why an issue occurred and guide users toward resolution, reducing rework and support dependency.
